name: places/ChIJfeelNWn2wokRTTLCRnCxYQI
formattedAddress: 1439 Amsterdam Ave # 1, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1439 Amsterdam Ave # 1, New York, NY 10027-7453, USA

originalText.text: This pharmacy is one of three in the area but they are definitely customer and detailed orientated in the services they offer. The pharmacist Alex remembers people personally down to your scripts. Even if you forget a refill you will be delightfully reminded when they are delivered. Also reminders if you need updated scripts.  The staff is knowledgeable, helpful and courteous also consistently same for many years that they definitely know who you are upon entering if you’re a regular. They also provide notary services, faxing and have a copy machine for customer use at a low .05 per page. You can also refill and pay phones here.

originalText.text: Omega has been my pharmacy for over 12 years. The pharmacist, Alex, goes out of his way to help me whenever I need.  The owners & the staff all know me by name & have all my medications ready when they're due.  Omega is the gold standard for pharmacies!!

text.text: Omega has been my pharmacy for over 12 years. The pharmacist, Alex, goes out of his way to help me whenever I need.  The owners & the staff all know me by name & have all my medications ready when they're due.  Omega is the gold standard for pharmacies!!

originalText.text: Absolutely phenomenal, treats their customer with a sense of urgency as a family member would for their loved ones. They did not hesitate to mail an important medication since I won't be there in person to pick it up in time. This is the kind of care and compassion you will never get at any CVS or Walgreens.

text.text: Absolutely phenomenal, treats their customer with a sense of urgency as a family member would for their loved ones. They did not hesitate to mail an important medication since I won't be there in person to pick it up in time. This is the kind of care and compassion you will never get at any CVS or Walgreens.

originalText.text: I moved new into the neighborhood about 2013 and was looking for a pharmacy. Sure I can go to Duane reade or CVS but I thought because this pharmacy is conveniently located in my neighborhood I would try them out. I have to say since the day I walked in there the whole staff has been very warm greeting me when I arrive up until I leave. They answer any concerns you may have, if they don't carry a certain medicine or item they conveniently order it for you AND deliver it to your door WITHOUT you even requesting it. They have 5 cent copier, $1 faxes, you can pay your cell phone bill there and some bills, I think they are a HUGE benefit to our neighborhood. If anyone is unhappy with their service they should express it to them personally and they'll be happy to work whatever issue out and keep you as a customer rather than lose a customer. Communication is key. We have to support our small businesses.

originalText.text: DO NOT FILL YOUR PRESCRIPTIONS HERE!  They gave me the wrong pills for my son and I returned both medications (my son spit out the liquid medicine said that it tasted different than the previous bottle we received from this pharmacy. Pharmacist said that it was because of a different manufacturer, although the both bottles said the same manufacturer company) I said to the pharmacist that I could not trust him, he said for me to have another pharmacy call him and he would transfer the prescriptions. New pharmacy called soon after and was told there was no prescription for my son!  This pharmacy is not to be trusted! They play with people's health only to make money! Fake, dishonest, INCOMPETENT people here.  Oh, and btw... the pharmacist told me that the wrong pills he gave my son was a "courtesy" bottle.
